description: Present participle or participial adjective from abide (verb) +‎ -ing; or, from Middle English participle form of abiden, abyden (“to abide”).

adjectives.description: abiding (comparative more abiding, superlative most abiding)

entries.meaning: Continuing or persisting in the same state: lasting, enduring; steadfast. [First attested around 1350 to 1470.]
examples: a deep and abiding hatred of wealth

description: From Middle English abydynge, abidynge, -inge [verbal noun of abiden, abyden (“to abide”)], from Old English abīdung; or, verbal noun from abide (verb) +‎ -ing.

entries.meaning: The action of one who abides; the state of an abider. [First attested from around 1150 to 1350.]
(obsolete) An abode. [First attested from around (1350 to 1470) until the early 17th century.]
